Hi,
In the food gathering experiment the phenotype network is fixed.
The CP=
PN evolve to give better and better weights to the network.

Assuming that =
the CPPN output can be visualized as an "image". 

Now: Let say that a hidd=
en node in the phenotype network is added 
during evolution. Can some predi=
ction about how the "image" changes 
be done?

If so, would it be possible =
to train a CPPN like network that take 
the "image" as input and as output =
try to place hidden nodes to the 
phenotype where they would do the most us=
e?

If it is possible to add a lot of hidden nodes to the phenotype, 
forci=
ng the CPPN to change the evolutionary course, can one add 
hidden nodes to=
 the phenotype network and still keep the CPPN in 
course? 

/Christofer
